# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code to solve your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " "$word) <= text_width
            push!(lines, current_line * " "$word)
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    
    # add the last line
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

For example, you can call this function with a string like: 

```julia
text = "This is a sample text. This is only for demonstration."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

and it will print the input string wrapped at every `text_width` characters (or 10 by default) as new lines.
